page.title: 13THE PEAR ORCHARD
page.content: There is a path going through the middle of the pear orchard. The trees are in straight rows. When the trees are too big some of them are taken out every 25 years. The pears from the pear orchard go to Shepton Mallet to be made into Babycham. We saw bees. The bees are there to pollenate the pear trees. There are lots of different trees in the orchard. The leaves on some of the trees are different. There are all different kinds of barks on the trees. These are all the kinds of pears: Butt, Red pear, Barnet, Hendre Huffcap, Winnals Longdon, Brown Bess, Bradley, New Bridge, Thorn, Hellens Early, Green Horse and Brandy. There are sheep to keep the grass down.
